title: Debit & Interac e-Transfer
description: Master the two most common ways to pay for everything in Canada.

content.title: Your Debit Card (Interac Debit)
content.text: In Canada, 'Debit' is the primary way to pay at stores. When you 'tap' or insert your card, money is taken directly from your chequing account. Most newcomers get a year of unlimited debit transactions, but be careful: some basic accounts charge a fee if you use it more than 25 times a month.

content.title: What is Interac e-Transfer?
content.text: This is a secure way to send money to anyone with a Canadian bank account using just their email or phone number. It is the standard way to pay rent to landlords or split a dinner bill with friends. Funds are usually delivered within minutes.

content.title: Autodeposit & Security
content.text: For extra security and speed, set up 'Autodeposit' in your banking app. This allows money sent to you to land in your account automatically without needing to answer a security question. Always verify the recipient's email before hitting send, as e-Transfers are very difficult to cancel once deposited.

quiz.question: What information do you need to send an Interac e-Transfer to someone?
options: Their home address and SIN number
Their email address or mobile phone number
quiz.explanation: To send an e-Transfer, all you need is the recipient's email or mobile number. The bank handles the rest securely.

quiz.question: What is the benefit of enabling 'Autodeposit' in your banking settings?
options: It gives you free money every month
It lets you receive money without answering a security question
It increases your credit score automatically
It allows you to use any ATM for free
quiz.explanation: Autodeposit is faster and more secure because it removes the risk of a security question being guessed by someone else.
